alert.note: Alert for Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:25PM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Pickens. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM EST, River gages along Twelve and Eighteen Mile Creeks were continuing to indicate flooding conditions. Watch for lingering flooding near the flea market and Concord Church Rd along 12 Mile Creek. Along 18 Mile creek, flooding is expected along Bishop Branch and Central Roads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
